content: k2tog repeat 4 sts round 23 s1 k1 psso repeat 2sts break yarn draw end through the remaining 2 sts secure and hide in hat finishing page 6 4 finishing girl finishing please note i find it easier to weave in all my ends at the end long hair for long hair cut a long piece of yarn that will be used to make the hair line see figure c step 1 starting on the right side near the head hole insert the needle above the shoulder and out through the head hole see figure a as you pull the yarn through leave as much hair dangling down the front as desired step 2 put the needle in just above the place you put it for step 1 again pull the needle out of the head hole see figure b do not leave any dangling hair since this stitch is starting the doll s bangs step 3 repeat step 2 as you loop around the head hole to the left stop once you reach the left shoulder step 4 once you have reached the left shoulder secure the yarn by making a small stitch let the remaining yarn dangle down and trim hair to match other side if desired untwist the plies to make the yarn look more hair like braids for braids cut a piece of yarn that is twice the desired length of your hair at the shoulder insert the needle under one stitch and out the other side pull the yarn through so it is the same length on either side of the stitch repeat this process on other shoulder then separate hair into three groups and make braids i like to knot mine so it is nice and secure filling out hair to fill out hair add yarn to back and sides like a fringe to a scarf see video link on pg 2 you can also add more braids if desired see figure d i sometimes separate my yarn plys by untwisting them i think this gives the yarn a more hair like quality sometimes you may even get a crimped/curly look figure a figure b figure c figure d 5 skirt decoration if desired add duplicate stitch to make hearts on the bottom of the dress choose a nice contrasting color so it is more visible against the dress weaving in ends put your finger puppet inside out weave in the ends i try not to weave in any ends where the head hole will show through as i think it looks messy i also try to weave my ends in to the same color so different colors don t show through girl with hijab finishing sewing on her hijab make sure the cast on end is weaved in slide the hijab for shoulders over the top of the head and into position see figure e i position the top just under the head hole use the cast off end to sew it into
